dublinCore.dc:title: 114 HR 4023 IH: Clean Up the Code Act of 2015
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Chabot (for himself, Mr. Goodlatte, Mr. Conyers, Ms. Jackson Lee, and Mr. Forbes) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To eliminate unused sections of the United States Code, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Clean Up the Code Act of 2015.
The following provisions of title 18, United States Code, are repealed:

paragraph.text: Section 46 relating to transportation of water hyacinths.
Section 511A relating to unauthorized application of theft prevention decal or device.
Section 707 relating to 4-H club emblem fraudulently used.
Section 708 relating to Swiss Confederation coat of arms.
Section 711 relating to Smokey Bear character or name.
Section 711a relating to Woodsy Owl character, name, or slogan.
Section 715 relating to The Golden Eagle Insignia.
Section 1921 relating to receiving Federal employees’ compensation after marriage.

subsection.text: The table of chapters for title 18, United States Code, is amended by striking the item relating to chapter 89.
The table of sections for chapter 3 of title 18, United States Code, is amended by striking the item relating to section 46.
The table of sections for chapter 25 of title 18, United States Code, is amended by striking the item relating to section 511A.
The table of sections for chapter 33 of title 18, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking the item relating to section 707;
by striking the item relating to section 708;
by striking the item relating to section 711;
by striking the item relating to section 711a; and
by striking the item relating to section 715.

subsection.text: The table of sections for chapter 93 of title 18, United States Code, is amended by striking the item relating to section 1921.
